Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Staff are not helpful”
Reviews.Author: Eddychahine
Reviews.Content: Nice location and it is good value for money. One challenge is that all rooms are twin bed. Restaurants are very nice and food is very good but staff are not helpful maybe due to language barrier. I might choose this hotel again. It depends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, close to the center of Istanbul,where you can find everything you want in walking distance. The stuf was very nice to us and tried to help us in every way it could. I believe that Elite World Prestige would be a nice place to stay while traveling with company or with family!

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: Tnrahimi
Reviews.Content: Being in Taksim is the most important advantage of this hotel,because it's really convenient for everywhere you may want to go.The hotel is really clean,the decoration is semi classic and very nice,but for a 5star hotel the rooms could be a bit bigger. The minibar is good. The breakfast is extremely complete,you can find everything you want in the breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: stefanorsi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off Taksim Square, in the very center of the city (yet far away from most sights), in a quiet pedestrian area where you would find a good number of little restaurants and delis. Front desk staff is not especially kind or helpful - they greeted me with charging my cc 25 euros more than supposed to (which was later on credited back to my account). Rooms are nothing special, trust me on this one. I would not say that they are small but they are not big either. They could use a bit of redecoration though. The bathroom was so little, I could hardly close the door when inside. Also it was a bit smelly. I would strongly recommend the maids use a bit more detergent when pretending to "clean up"... it would make a big difference! All in all, my stay was not horrible (except for very loud children in the room next to mine keeping me awake all night but the hotel cannot be blamed for that) but I am not convinced I should return...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Autumn E
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is exceptional. Erdem Ekmen at the front desk was particularly helpful. He went out of his way to help me navigate the domestic bus lines and make sure that I was taken care of. I would recommend this hotel for its location and staff. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal - kind service, perfect location, small room”
Reviews.Author: SimonePec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few blocks from the Taksim Square, where we found many good restaurants, shops, bars, cafes. My husdband and I felt safe to walk around even late at night. Also, we had pleasant (although long) walks to most of the main turistic attractions, what made this a very convenient place to stay. We arrived early (before check-in time) so the room was not ready; but the hotel could store our luggage in a closed room which has lockers where we left our documents and valuables safely during the day. The bad part is that our room was very small and noisy. Because it is a small hotel, and the room was close to the elevator, we could hear all guests and employees coming and going in the corridor.... However, we just stayed inside during sleeping hours... too much to do and to visit outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marirahn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights, reception was very friendly.The services were professional, breakfast with wide selection.

Reviews.Title: “first of all : "kindness"”
Reviews.Author: pincapallina50
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from Istanbul where in this hotel I've organized an international meeting. - The location is perfect, of course if you choose to stay in the european side. - Rooms and baths not very big but not very little, a right size..... - Breakfast is very Ok also for quantity than for the quantity and the choise. - the lonely thing in which I found some problems were the informations to the personnel of the reception, sometimes not updated in the real time. But the top of this Hotel in this situation, have been the availability and the kindness of all the personnel that is an added value very important. A special thanks to Gaye and Serpil that have supported us ever with a smile and that let me to feel at my home..... Anna Maria

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ã  eviter / Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: amf54
Reviews.Content: The price is very too expensive fo a low quality overall. We were very disappointed by the room and the staff. We booked 7 nights for a non-smoker room and we came with our baby. We changed 3 times: - The fisrt night ,hey gave us the smaller room of the floor and it was a smoker room. Reason: No room available anymore. Very strange as they didn't reserve the room we booked on their website. Actually, we understood they give you the available room....!!! - I demanded a new room. So the 2nd and 3nd, we got a bigger room but very very very NOISY!! We couldn't sleep because of the noise from the Air conditionner + the exeternal hot pump. Incredible! You pay for a 4 stars hotel and you can't sleep. Is it normal? - 4th night to the last one, we got a calm room in the front BUT it included 2 bedsÂ¨!!! So what you want : Sleeping? or Noise? I don't recommend this hotel. Bad quality for a 4 stars and too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly up to rating given.. 4 stars more like 2”
Reviews.Author: woodcotefarms
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is next to Elite World Hotel. Prestige uses the good hotel next door to ruse clients. Some people eventually sifted next door. Do check before you book! The AC never worked although we compained every night for 10 nights. We were shifted to another room where other facilities also didnt work and the AC was marginally better but you needed to have outside window open at which time all you could hear was the generators thumping all night. Location great and room service good. Having a bath or shower (over the bath)was like climbing Everest.. You needed a step ladder to get in and out safely. Receptionist staff were obviously sick to death of people complaining about the AC and tended to be surly when, as always happened, people complained.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: patslaiby
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife to attend the Bon Jovi concert and stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.I asked for a non smoking room and they gave me a room that smelled with cigarettes.I asked a double bed so they went up before me and pushed two beds together.I asked for another room and complained about the smell, all the employee told me was that he can send someone to spray perfume in the room.The toilets were not clean, and they never knew how to clean them well while our stay, the trash was full and the complimentary tea bags were used by the previous occupants. The hotel location is really good, but other than that I would not recommend anyone to go.It's a shame as they have potential.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NOT COME BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: jnjoom
Reviews.Content: HOSPITALITY and hospitality those people running this hotel need a lot or training about hospitality , we didn't find a smile on one face during our 4 days we had there no even one welcome word to hear from them . for the breakfast it was a little poor in food variety ,there was always 3 persons watching us while eating i don't know why but room service is okay , and clean . it's located in a quite busy hotels area near Taksim square which you can reach within 5 minutes , besides you have to avoid all sales men from different restaurants while they are following you offering there meals all the way in and out of the hotel . very expensive shops and goods in this street comparing to other streets in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would not seek it out if I were back in town”
Reviews.Author: plightfo
Reviews.Content: Decent business hotel. Close to Taksim Square and about a 30-minute walk from the Galata Bridge. Plenty of restaurants close by. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. It was a bit of climb to get into the shower/bath. Not a problem for us, but it might be tricky for elderly travellers. The only real complaint I have is that the wireless internet service was weak and slow. Not good for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HOTEL ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: PPolicier
Reviews.Content: Inhospitaliy, uncleanness, and coldness is all you can experience at Elite World Prestige Hotel. You should sleep with your coat on, because they don't operate heater in cold rainy winter nights. They charge everything, including a bottle of water on the table in your room. There are hundreds of decent hotels in Taksim area, with reasonable price and Turkish hospitality. This hotel is a shame of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hell.. Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: merrmerr
Reviews.Content: The whole trip appeared to be hell because of this hotel. first, when checking in, there was a terrible smell of cigarettes, though they said it was a room for non-smoking. then i was shocked seeing the full garbage bin, and it too smelled cigarettes! i've asked to move to other room. my fortune was that the bin was full again... then, my family decided to go to other city for few days, and the hotel manager offered his help for booking the transfer and hotel. we paid for a group, as there were more than 6 of us. on the half way the driver stopped, saying that we need to change the car and join a group of about 50 people. only after 40 minutes of desperate negotiations, and threatening to sue, we were finally taken to the destination on current car by ourselves. many minor unpleasant things happened after as well.

Reviews.Title: “My worst hote experience”
Reviews.Author: milihegde
Reviews.Content: lack of hospitality............................. helpless state being foreigners to this country and hotel Upon that we came with a smal baby where we lost gold worth fortune which was left in the room in the bag and realized it only after we reachd another country but are very sure that it was stolen in the room when we left out for sight seeing. informed the hotel but no response.....we are not ble to help as we are foreigners

Reviews.Title: “Great service excellent service well situated”
Reviews.Author: pinkNorwich
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel well situated,excellent and staff,food very good well presented all amenities

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Aliochs
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is OK, decent rooms (not tried the breakfast nor the restaurant). It is well placed (but there are other hotels in the same street too). However, some minor annoyances: 1. Soundproofing is not great (you can hear clearly phone ringing, baby crying, doors slamming and the cleaners in the morning) 2. On the 2nd of September, I came back to my room at around 9pm to find out that the AC is not working. I ask the reception (no feedback from them afterwards). I call again at 11pm. As I see no feedback, I call again at 11.10pm, to being told that IT IS NOT ANYMORE SUMMER IN ISTANBUL, THAT'S WHY THEY SHUT OFF THE AC, and that "YOU CAN OPEN YOUR WINDOW IF THE ROM IS TOO WARM). No comments....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel recommended”
Reviews.Author: jad7
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel 5 days , went to istanbul for u 2 concert , a double room for 80 dol/night !!! location is downtown istanbul , very touristic surrounding many hotels nearby , pedestrian area, i wasn t expecting this for 80 dollars , to be frank i didn t try the food.Service was great , room clean ,spacious ,fully equiped. good pool , hammam...etc.if u go here you must try the massage with SAID , great massage best on eever ( hammam too) not expensive for a 4 stars hotel.the exerience was great ,city cool relaxing knowing that it s10 min away from the bosphore. must try

Reviews.Title: “a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: francisGent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel beginning of may 2010, being recommended by a friend who works there. and she is very right : topclass for situation so close to Taksim Square, but still pretty quiet for the center of Istanbul. Good restaurant and bar, friendly and correct service. good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: manch245
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel i stayed . The problem started when we first come to the reception. Although , check-in time is at 13:00 according to Booking.com, at 13:20 they said our room was not ready and they claimed tht check-in is at 14:00. When I showed my booking.com confirmation email. They just looked stupidly without any sorry. Then, I learned that they already charged my credit card for my stay. It can be ok according to booking.com conditions but it never happened before with other hotels. We took the keys and go to the room. Probably, it was the worst room in the hotel with wine marks on the wall and more importantly there were two single beds although i booked a double room. I called reception and they told me this is the only room they have. I told them then why are you selling a room that you dont have. They didnt say anything and ofered to unite beds. If you book a room in this hotel be prepared , a similar situation. The problems with this hotel never ends. The shower was a terrible experience as well. The shower was leaking water on the sides. Luckily, we stayed in this hotel for a day, I wouldnt stand to this hotel. They claim this hotel has 4 stars but i think it can at most be a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing names - better choice next door”
Reviews.Author: wodis
Reviews.Content: Confusingly there are two hotels right next to each other in the Sehit Muhtar Caddesi - a grand 5 star called "Elite World Hotel" (No. 42) and a somewhat less grand 4 star, the "Elite World Prestige Hotel at No. 58. Most sites on the internet don't seem to know the difference such that confusion reigns. The latter is where we stayed and though not grand, my room was clean, sufficiently large and with working air conditioning. Breakfast was sufficient if not lavish. The wireless internet connection worked fine. So overall a hotel of good to average quality. On the down side: My colleagues were asked to move rooms during the stay, despite having booked early. Also I was annoyed at having to pay 12 Lira for a 500 ml bottle of water - which I had falsely assumed to be complementary. At shops just a few meters away this would have cost no more than 1 TL. Staff were friendly enough during the stay, but having left my luggage during the last day and picking it up in the evening they were generally unhelpful in regaining it. Also getting them to phone a shuttle to the airport was quite a struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience - Do not book this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: champers22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week as I was on a conference in Istanbul. The hotel Elite World prestige, is beside a hotel with confusingly the same name and I wished I had stayed there instead! The room we had was tiny, the guy on the desk said it had a king-size bed. Now king-size for really small people!! It was not even as big as a double bed. The air-conditioning kept breaking down and we reported it every day and asked for a room change - we didn't get it.It was only on the last night they told us they switched the hotel's air-conditioning off in the evening (not very nice in a scorching hot August). The porter taking our luggage up to the room told us "mini-bar pay, water free"... we drank the water and got stung 12 Lira for it as it is not actually free! To get into the shower you have to scale the side of the bath which was unusually high - not suitable for children or not flexible/double jointed people! Some staff were downright rude but some were really nice. The breakfast was OK. There was a pool but we didn;t use it. The hotel is located in Taksim so it was easy to get around. It is advertised as a 4-star hotel.... more like 2 star I think!

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience ever”
Reviews.Author: SabahDubai
Reviews.Content: No water after 9:00 pm and the AC stopped working after midnight. Moved to the Elite World Hotel next to it and liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: wcislak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip from April 28, 2008 thru June 27, 2008. I had three different rooms during my stay, all of which were horrible to stay in. The first room was 716, it had a two twin size beds and a mini-fridge which did not work at all. The air conditioner unit would give out after a couple hours of running and actually start heating the room. The windows opened and let in a nice breeze, but housekeeping would close them during the day making the room unbearably hot while I was away from the hotel. The second room was 306, the room had a queen size bed, but was a smoking room. (I am a non-smoker) The air conditioner in this room did not work at all. I left several notes on the thermostat requesting repair as well as asking at the front desk daily. They never did send anyone to fix this. The bathroom had a floor drain in it which would fill up with sewage water an leave a sickly odor in the entire room! The last room was not much better than the first. The air did not work and the hotel again did nothing to fix it. The hotel is located directly next door to a double set of train tracks which run by the hotel about every 5 minutes. Even with windows closed on the lower floors it was impossible not to be woken up during the night by these trains. (All room numbers ending in 10 or higher are on the train track side of the building, but the sound goes through the whole building!) The breakfast is a typical Asian style consisting mainly of breads. Lunch-meat cut style meats are not kept cool at all, just on a tray at room temperature all morning. Orange juice is watered down at least 90%, and barely resembles juice at all. 10th floor restaurant has very nice staff and pretty decent menu. Stay away from the ravioli though! Everything else I had was very good though. All meals range from 10-20 YTL (US $8-$16) a good price for what you get. A .5 liter can of soda was 5 YTL (US $4.15) at the restaurant or from the room mini-bar. Fortunately there is a very good priced convenience store just across the street called "Takko Shop" where you can get them for much less and put them in the mini-fridge. Don't expect to find any vending machines or any ice machines at this hotel. They do not have them. At check-out, hotel tried to charge me for alcohol they said I removed from the mini-bar. (very outrageous prices!) I told them that this was not possible as I have a severe allergy to alcohol which causes my face/neck/chest to break out into hives and can even affect my breathing. They argued with me on removing these charges. I told them I would be more than happy to have my doctor fax them medical proof of my allergy. (they finally gave in when I mentioned this.) I advise finding somewhere else to get laundry done other than the in house laundry service. The prices are outrageously high. Two months worth of laundry (1 jeans, 1 t-shirt, 1 underwear, and 1 socks daily) cost me 2000 YTL ($1653 USD with airport bank currency exchange.) Hotel offers to exchange US currency for Turkish Lira at a 1:1 rate. (This is nowhere near bank exchange rate, even airport exchange rates! Real rip-off!)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't honour my booking!”
Reviews.Author: travman999
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 weeks ago through hotels.com and received instant confirmation. I arrived on the day only to find that the hotel claimed my travel agent had cancelled my booking and sent me around the corner to another hotel. This was not true - looks like they had a better offer to host a conference and decided to cancel my booking and blame someone else!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: vafa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and safe, which is the first pririty for a family trip. Location is amazing, close to Taksim square and all yoru needs are there. Good contact to historical places. Friendly staff, english speaking and very helpful. Wireless internet access Good breakfast Health club Safe box in room big rooms good aircondition system.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: jknight910
Reviews.Content: Stayed December 28th through January 2, 2005. This is a good four star hotel with a great location near Taksim square. Only a 5-10 minute walk to the main streets of Taksim and approximately a 20 minute walk to the trendy areas of Istanbul. Basically, even with rain, everything in the new city is within walking distance to the hotel. Also close by are internet cafes, a good Italian restaurant next store, and plenty of taxies. Taxies to the old city ran approximately $5USD. I would recommend staying in the new city. More to do after hours. The old city may be less expensive byt once night falls, there is nothing to do. The new city is alive 24/7. The staff was outstanding and helpful but breakfast was merely adequate. Not bad, just adequate. They had a pool but I never used it. Tours could be arranged at the front desk but if you are going to Istanbul on vacation you are probably savvy enough to tour with taking a â€œtour.â€� Most importantly, I would stay at this hotel again should I end up in Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: Elite World Prestige Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sehit Muhtar Cad No 40 | Taksim, Istanbul 34435, Turkey
